title: My theory: Ornn is a blacksmith support character who can give unique items/upgrades to allies
body: But we shall learn quite soon.

replies.body: He's supposed to be a vanguard tank, so I have doubts towards team buffs.  I think he can make terrain.

> [{quoted}](name=Blood Magicks,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8kLGxoVT,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-08-07T13:09:58.691+0000)
>
> So, a tank Taliyah?

More like an Ornn Ornn.

But Trundle is more of a juggernaut and Jarvan a diver.
Vanguards don't deal a lot of damage,but have a lot of CC and good engage abilities.
He is just speaking about their terrain creating abilities as a comparison, since he expects Ornn to be able to do the same.

I think the opposite.
He will probably be able to **destroy** terrain as part of his kit.

Riot was trying to create a champion with that feature for a really long time now, but they just didn't figure out how to implement correctly.
It's likely that they finally succeeded (just like they finally implemented their vision of the "assassin support" with Rakan) and Ornn is the product.

And even if he doesn't have team buffs (still possible as a smith, though), it's possible that he will turn out as a support.
They said he will be rather self reliant,so I doubt that he'll be a support.

I don't think he will be or be playable as support. My guess: 1. toplane 2. jungle 

I think he could ve something in his kit to make e.g. a wall. And than maybe a spell to destroy it or pull someone towards him.

Jungle seems very unlikely, they try to avoid giving new champions to the same position two times in a row.
The last champion released was Kayn, a jungler. Therefore it is pretty much ruled out that the next champion is designed to be a jungler as well.

I think best bet is top laner.

Ok, ty. But I pointed out that top lane might be his primary role anyway. 

(And btw: a demi-god who built the howling abyss, has to be an independent toplaner)
